Fireworks have been around a long time.
Invented in China probably in the second century BC,...
...they were used to celebrate all the important life events.
They became popular in Europe for military victories,...
Eventually, they made it to the United States...
...and were even used at the very first Fourth of July party in 1776.
Originally, fireworks were made from black powder...
...stuffed into bamboo shoots and thrown into fire.
They've changed a bit since then,...
...but they are still a crucial part of any grand celebration.
